fokus 0.0.9010
  • Reference

Determine whether majoritarian election requires candidate registration

Source: R/fokus.gen.R
requires_candidate_registration.Rd

Determines whether or not candidates must be officially registered prior to the specified majority election.

requires_candidate_registration(
  ballot_date = ballot_dates,
  lvl = c("cantonal", "federal"),
  canton = cantons,
  election_nr = 1L
)

Arguments

ballot_date

A valid FOKUS-covered cantonal ballot date. One of

  • "2018-09-23"

  • "2018-11-25"

  • "2019-10-20"

  • "2020-09-27"

  • "2020-10-18"

  • "2021-11-28"
lvl

Political level. One of

  • "cantonal"

  • "federal"
canton

A valid FOKUS canton. One of

  • "aargau"
election_nr

Election number. A positive integer scalar (in almost all cases 1L).

Value

A logical scalar.

Details

The absence of a candidate registration requirement usually means that every eligible citizen can be elected, i.e. receive valid votes.

See also

Other election predicate functions election_candidate_string(), election_candidates(), election_names_combined(), election_name(), election_parties(), election_tickets(), n_election_candidates(), n_election_seats()

Examples

fokus::requires_candidate_registration(ballot_date = "2019-10-20",
                                       lvl = "federal",
                                       canton = "aargau")

#> [1] FALSE
